exercises.intro: Let's start this session with the Child's Pose! Time to bring out your inner child and relax like there's no tomorrow!
exercises.instructions: Begin on your hands and knees, then sit back on your heels and reach your arms forward. Rest your forehead on the mat and take deep breaths.

exercises.intro: Moving on to the Cat Pose! Get ready to stretch and arch your back like a graceful feline!
exercises.instructions: Start on your hands and knees, exhale as you round your spine towards the ceiling. Inhale as you arch your back and look up.

exercises.intro: Now, let's flow into the Cow Pose! Time to moo-ve that spine and open up your heart!
exercises.instructions: From the Cat Pose, inhale as you drop your belly towards the mat, lift your chin and chest, and gaze forward.

exercises.intro: Up next is the Downward Facing Dog! Let's stretch it out and feel the power in this classic yoga pose!
exercises.instructions: Start on your hands and knees, lift your hips up and back, straightening your arms and legs. Press your heels towards the ground.

exercises.intro: Time for the Extended Puppy Pose! Get ready to melt your heart towards the earth and feel the deep stretch in your spine!
exercises.instructions: From Downward Facing Dog, lower your forearms to the mat while keeping your hips high. Walk your hands forward and relax your chest towards the ground.

exercises.intro: Moving on to the Cobra Pose! Time to awaken your spine and embrace the strength within!
exercises.instructions: Lie on your stomach, place your palms under your shoulders and lift your chest up while keeping your elbows close to your body. Gaze forward.

exercises.intro: Let's now flow into the Bridge Pose! Get ready to lift your hips and open up your heart to new possibilities!
exercises.instructions: Lie on your back, bend your knees and place your feet flat on the mat. Press into your feet to lift your hips up, while keeping your shoulders grounded.

exercises.intro: Last but not least, the Corpse Pose! Time to relax, unwind, and let go of any remaining tension.
exercises.instructions: Lie on your back, close your eyes, and let your body sink into the mat. Take slow, deep breaths and allow yourself to fully relax.
